Sentencas: The study is focused on the synthesis and characterization of (La0.75Ca0.25)(0.95)Cr1-xFexO3-delta (x = 0.3 - 0.9) perovskites as potential materials for solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) cathode and anode.
Titulo: PEROVSKITE-LIKE (La0.75Ca0.25)0.95Cr1-xFexO3-δ AS POTENTIAL ELECTRODE MATERIALS FOR SYMMETRIC SOLID OXIDE FUEL CELLS

Sentencas: These materials possessanorthorhombically-distorted structure at room temperature whilst heating above 800-1100 K induces reversible transformation into the rhombohedral symmetry.
Titulo: PEROVSKITE-LIKE (La0.75Ca0.25)0.95Cr1-xFexO3-δ AS POTENTIAL ELECTRODE MATERIALS FOR SYMMETRIC SOLID OXIDE FUEL CELLS

Sentencas: The transition temperature increases with iron content.
Titulo: PEROVSKITE-LIKE (La0.75Ca0.25)0.95Cr1-xFexO3-δ AS POTENTIAL ELECTRODE MATERIALS FOR SYMMETRIC SOLID OXIDE FUEL CELLS

Sentencas: The linear thermal expansion coefficients vary in the range (10.5-11.1)x10(-6) K-1 and slightly grow on Fe-doping.
Titulo: PEROVSKITE-LIKE (La0.75Ca0.25)0.95Cr1-xFexO3-δ AS POTENTIAL ELECTRODE MATERIALS FOR SYMMETRIC SOLID OXIDE FUEL CELLS

Sentencas: The volume changes upon reduction are within 0.16%.
Titulo: PEROVSKITE-LIKE (La0.75Ca0.25)0.95Cr1-xFexO3-δ AS POTENTIAL ELECTRODE MATERIALS FOR SYMMETRIC SOLID OXIDE FUEL CELLS

Sentencas: The electronic conductivity exhibits a thermally-activated character and increases on Fe introduction, in particular due to an enhancement of the number of sites available for electronic transfer; this trend is observed both under oxidizing and reducing conditions.
Titulo: PEROVSKITE-LIKE (La0.75Ca0.25)0.95Cr1-xFexO3-δ AS POTENTIAL ELECTRODE MATERIALS FOR SYMMETRIC SOLID OXIDE FUEL CELLS

Sentencas: The low level of the electronic conductivity seems to be responsible for an insufficient electrochemical activity of (La0.75Ca0.25)(0.95)Cr1-xFexO3-delta-based cathodes.
Titulo: PEROVSKITE-LIKE (La0.75Ca0.25)0.95Cr1-xFexO3-δ AS POTENTIAL ELECTRODE MATERIALS FOR SYMMETRIC SOLID OXIDE FUEL CELLS

Sentencas: Under anodic conditions, other factors, such as electrode microstructure or surface-related properties, affect the electrochemical behavior.
Titulo: PEROVSKITE-LIKE (La0.75Ca0.25)0.95Cr1-xFexO3-δ AS POTENTIAL ELECTRODE MATERIALS FOR SYMMETRIC SOLID OXIDE FUEL CELLS
